title: Introducing gpt-realtime and Realtime API updates
optimized_headline: Discover GPT-Realtime: What the Latest API Updates Mean for You
raw_excerpt: We’re releasing a more advanced speech-to-speech model and new API capabilities including MCP server support, image input, and SIP phone calling support.
raw_body: We’re releasing a more advanced speech-to-speech model and new API capabilities including MCP server support, image input, and SIP phone calling support.
speedrun: A new advanced speech-to-speech model and API updates have been launched, enhancing capabilities like MCP server support and image input. These developments also include SIP phone calling support, making communication more versatile. This matters now as it could significantly improve how businesses and developers integrate AI into their products and services, streamlining communication and interaction.
why_it_matters: Businesses could leverage these updates to enhance customer interactions through more natural communication tools.
This reflects a broader trend towards integrating AI into everyday tools, making technology more accessible and functional.

lenses.eli12: The latest updates mean that AI can now understand and respond to spoken language even better. Think of it like a smart assistant that not only listens but can also hold a conversation. This matters because it makes technology feel more human, improving how we connect with devices in our daily lives.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, these updates highlight an increasing user demand for seamless communication tools. By integrating the new speech-to-speech model and API features, products could become more efficient and user-friendly, ultimately enhancing customer satisfaction and engagement.
lenses.engineer: From a technical perspective, the advanced speech-to-speech model could improve natural language processing benchmarks, making interactions smoother. The addition of MCP server support and image input expands functionality, allowing for more complex data handling and communication scenarios, which could lead to innovative applications.
